definition: to compel/to force
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
stubborn/unyielding
surname Qiang
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
to force (sb to do sth)/to compel/to press for/to extort/to press on towards/to press up to/to close in on/euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]

sentences.english: They WILL learn something at every opportunity you don't have to force it.
sentences.chinese: 他們會在每個機會學東西，你不用強逼他們。

sentences.english: The Amorites confined the Danites to the hill country, not allowing them to come down into the plain.
sentences.chinese: 亞摩利人強逼但人住在山地，不容他們下到平原。

sentences.english: The legalization of addictive drugs would in no way force individuals into the habit.
sentences.chinese: 成癮性藥物的合法化，絕不會強逼人們吸毒成性。

sentences.english: And the Amorites forced the children of Dan into the mountain: for they would not suffer them to come down to the valley
sentences.chinese: 亞摩利人強逼但人住在山地，不容他們下到平原。

sentences.english: ' He won't force it on to you, but he waits to give it to you.
sentences.chinese: 祂不會強逼你接受，但祂等着把救恩給你。

sentences.english: Ruan Joe rushed told his son to apologize, but l don't want to make him escape.
sentences.chinese: 阮喬見狀叫兒子道歉，但逸升不想強逼他。

sentences.english: Do not let me alone, plz.
sentences.chinese: 我不要再忍耐和強逼自己忘記從前。

sentences.english: The North has previously used aggression to force negotiations.
sentences.chinese: 朝鮮此前慣於利用咄咄態勢來強逼進行談判。

definition: to thwart/to obstruct (sth)
not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
to harbor hard feelings
to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
lit. to enter by the back door/fig. to gain influence by pull or unofficial channels/back door or under the counter connections
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
to interrogate/to cross-examine/to inquire
to lament/to complain tearfully/to wail accusingly
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
use both carrot and stick/use gentle methods and force/an iron hand in a velvet glove
to set a trap
to involve/to implicate sb/to spread to others (harm, trouble, damage etc)
to rope in/fig. to involve sb/to entice
to slander/to smear/to vilify
